name: Aladino - Corojo Reserva - LE Robusto
additionalNotes: Dedicated to bringing back the look, flavor, and aroma from the Golden Age of Cigars, which was from the late forties to the early sixties, the Aladino Corojo Reserva hits the mark right on the nose. A Honduran puro, the Aladino Corojo Reserva, as it name clearly states, uses Cuban-seed Corojo tobaccos to create a full-strength stick and a classic flavor profile that consists of earth, cedar, tobacco and pepper with a floral touch. The Aladino Corojo Reserva is one premium cigar that, once smoked, will earn a permanent place in your humidor.
